page.title: 01CRAIGELLACHIE
page.content: General - most important feature of Craigellachie on junction of A941 Elgin-Huntley and A95 Grantown-Keith roads. It is on confluence of Rivers Spey and Fiddich. Craigellachie grew around the railway, brewery and brickworks (all now defunct) also distillery (still existing). In N.E. corner of area is hamlet of Maggiknockater. Area divided N-S by steep valley of rivers Fiddich and Spey. In N ground rises sharpley to lower slopes of Ben Aigen and to S to summit of Blue Hill. Most of area consists of mixed farms with areas of coniferous plantation in S. 80m above sea level. Population approximately 500. Industries - Distillery: 2 cooperages: instrument maker: tourism (mostly salmon fishing). Amenities - Village hall, recreation field with tennis courts and football pitch,
